info.title: Creditsafe Connect OpenAPI Documentation
info.description:
Introduction

Creditsafe Connect is a REST API that provides access to the Creditsafe Global Company Database allowing you to control your master data, utlise up-to-date Business and Director information to enhance your onboarding and qualification processes, and get alerts when your customer's and supplier's Credit Report changes.

Quick Start

To start your Creditsafe Connect API integration you will need to have activated your account and set a password by following the instructions in your Welcome Email. If you have not received a Welcome Email please contact your Creditsafe Account Manager.

Using a REST API client construct an `/authenticate` POST request and enter your username & password (case-sensitive) into the POST body. A successful response will return an `authentication token`.

Use the `authentication token` in an `Authorization` header on all other Creditsafe Connect calls as proof of your authenticity.

Resources

  • OpenAPI specification.
  • Postman Collection of the most common example calls to Creditsafe Connect.
  • A Front End Demo Site. Use this as a quick easy way to validate your username & password and form requests.
  • Help Articles including FAQs, Data Dictionaries and a Feature Availability Matrix.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Endpoint to generate a Bearer JWT (Authentication Token). It is mandatory to include this token under the Header  `Authorization` When calling all other endpoints as proof of authenticity. Tokens can exist concurrently and persist for 1 hour from its issued time.

tags.name: Companies
tags.description: Endpoints to search for Companies in the Creditsafe Global Company Database. When a company is found you can use the `connectId` to order their Company Credit Report. The Company Credit Report is a JSON object comprising of key business and financial data points such as Credit Score & Limit, Industry Code, Directors, Balance Sheet and Negative Information. A full list of Company data points can be found in the Data Matrix, in the help resources.

tags.name: People/Directors
tags.description: Endpoints to find People/Directors and order Director Reports. A Director Report will contain a person's registered information and Active & Previous Directorships, where available. This endpoint is not advised to get a list of directors for a specifc Company. Instead, order a Company Credit Report using the `/companies/{id}` endpoint, and use  the `directors` section in the response.

tags.name: Images
tags.description: Endpoints to order official Company Image Documents from original sources. Company Filings such as Annual Account Statements, Annual Returns, Liquidations and Changes of Registered Information can be downloaded as PDFs, and are typically used as a resource in extended company auditing/compliance.

tags.name: Fresh Investigations
tags.description: Endpoints to manage Fresh Investigation requests. With the need for accurate data, you can check on any company that is not available within our instant online database by placing a Fresh Investigation (Offline Order). Depending on the market, the information we obtain will vary. Using official sources and registries we are able to quickly answer questions about a companyâ€™s stability and financial health. Where official information is not available we will conduct a direct interview with the business.

tags.name: Global Monitoring
tags.description: Endpoints to Monitor changes to Company Information. Company changes can be retrived by creating a Porfolio (a collection of companies) and configuring the `eventRules` (the criteria in which to trigger a change, e.g. company name changes, limit changes) on the portfolio. When a company in your Portfolio changes to satisfy an eventRule, a `notificationEvent` will be raised to inform you of the nature of the change. See here for Creditsafe's Global Monitoring capabilities.

tags.name: Decision Engine
tags.description: Endpoints to run bespoke credit decisions on Companies. You can find more information on the Decision Engine here

post.description: Enter your username and password into the request schema to generate an Authorization Token

example.message: Access denied -  Please check that your username and password are correct.  Please be aware that usernames and passwords are case sensitive. If the problem persists, please contact your Creditsafe account manager.

get.description: Endpoint to search for Companies based on the provided Search Criteria. To get the most relevant results, it is recommended to use a unique identifer such as `regNo` where available. If a unique identiifer is not available, use a combination of the companies registered `postCode` and `name` for the next best hit rate.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: A Comma-separated list of country codes to search for Companies in. The list takes ISO/Alpha 2 format country codes. For example US,GB represents searching for Companies in the United States and Great Britain.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Search Language -  Typically only used for Countries where more than one  Company Names exist in different languages. Such as Companies with a Japanese Kanji and English names.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: connectId - The primary Company identifier that is used to uniquely identify all companies across Creditsafe''s Universe and Partner Network. This is returned on all Company Search Results. Use this field to use in other operations such as Ordering Company Credit Report by Id, and Adding Company to Monitoing Portfolio. </br></br> [Searching by connectID is a slightly redundant operation (can be used as a fast-lookup to Search Result fields) as the purpose of Search is to obtain this identifier].

parameters.name: safeNo
parameters.description: Safe Number - Creditsafe's identifier on all Companies owned in the Creditsafe Universe. This is returned on all Company Search Results

parameters.name: regNo
parameters.description: Local Company Identifier - The Company identifier typically associated with a Government Filing Agency. i.e. French SIREN/SIRET, United Kingdom Companies House CRN.

parameters.name: vatNo
parameters.description: Company VAT Number

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Company Name

parameters.name: tradeName
parameters.description: Trade Name of the Company, typically used in Countries where Name is not uniquely registered.

parameters.name: acronym
parameters.description: A (non-unique) identifier to look for Companies by their more commonly known acronym rather than their lesser known full name. Acronym is predominantly available on French Companies.

parameters.name: exact
parameters.description: Provide as true to find Companies matching a Name exactly.

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Street of the Company

parameters.name: houseNo
parameters.description: Address part identifier - House/Building Number of the Company

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: Address part identifier - City of the Company

parameters.name: postCode
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Postcode/Zip Code of the Company. Can be provided partially to extend to a region with a * as a wildcard. I.e. CF* can represnt all postcodes starting with CF.

parameters.name: province
parameters.description: Address part identifier - Province/State of the Company

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Phone Number of the Company

parameters.name: officeType
parameters.description: Indicates whether the Company is a Head Office or a Branch

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Indicates whether the Company is Active/Trading

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Indicates whether the Company is Limited or NonLimited. Countries without a concept of Limited/NonLimited Companies will not be affected by this parameter

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of Companies per page

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

messages.text: No companies matching specified search criteria found.

get.description: Orders a Company's Credit Report by connectId.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Report Language - The JSON structure of the Report is language invariant, but field content will return as the given language, where available.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: Optional parameter to request a Templated Company Report. A Template adds/reduces sections of the Credit Report depending on your subscription. Do not include this parameter if you have not been given a template to use.

parameters.name: customData
parameters.description: A Key-Value pair (as a string format key::value) that is required for certain Report requests. I.e. German Report Reason Code. Use /reportcustomdata/{country} endpoint to see the necessary structure/values.

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The connectId (optionally Safe Number where available) of the Company required to order their Credit Report. Obtained from `/companies` search results.

get.description: Returns the set of available Company Search parameters/fields for a provided list of countries.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: A comma separated list of ISO/Alpha 2 format country codes, or singular country Code. e.g. US,GB will return the common searchable Company fields in the United States and Great Britain.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: Use CompanyReportResponse for the Company Credit Report JSON schema, DirectorReportResponse for the Director Report JSON schema.

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: For Templated Company Report JSON Schemas

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: ISO2 / Alpha 2 Country Code

get.description: Returns the available countries in your subscription by operation - Company Report, Director Report, Offline Reports and Monitoring.

Creditsafe Connect Online Reports.countryName: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

get.description: Endpoint to find Directors based on search criteria to order a Creditsafe Director Report.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of countries to search for People with registered directorships against. The list takes ISO/Alpha 2 format country codes. For example US,GB represents searching for People/Directorships in the United States and Great Britain.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: connectId - The primary Company identifier that is used to uniquely identify all companies across Creditsafe's Universe and Partner Network.

parameters.name: regNo
parameters.description: Local Company Identifier - The Company identifier typically associated with a Government Filing Agency. i.e. French SIREN/SIRET, United Kingdom Companies House CRN

parameters.name: safeNumber
parameters.description: Safe Number - Creditsafe's identifier on all Companies owned in the Creditsafe Universe. This is returned on all Company Search Results

parameters.name: peopleId
parameters.description: Person/Director Identifier - used to order a Director Report.

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Person's First Name.

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Person's Last Name

parameters.name: companyName
parameters.description: Company Name of the Director's Company (Only use this for Directorship Searches, unavailable in Director Search)

parameters.name: companyNumber
parameters.description: Local Registration Idenitifier of the Director's Company (Only use this for Directorship Searches, unavailable in Director Search).

parameters.name: localDirectorNumber
parameters.description: Local Identifier of the Director, the PNR in GB.

parameters.name: dateOfBirth
parameters.description: Person DOB - provide YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM format.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of directors per page

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

messages.text: No directors matching specified search criteria found.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Report Language - The JSON structure of the Report is language invariant, but field content will return as the given language, where available.

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

parameters.name: personId
parameters.description: Identifier of the Person/Director required to order their Director Report. Obtained from `/people` search results.

get.description: Returns the set of available People Search parameters/fields for a provided list of countries.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: A comma separated list of ISO/Alpha 2 format country codes, or singular country Code. e.g. US,GB will return the common searchable People/Director fields in the United States and Great Britain.

get.description: Endpoint to return mandatory parameters or metadata associated with specific country Company Report requests. To add a custom data parameter, add a Parameter with the key=value pair in the format customData=key::allowedValue I.e. Suppling `DE` as a country code will return a list of reasons for requesting a DE Credit Report (which is a legal requirement to supply with each Credit Report request in Germany). This will provide a list of allowedValues to enter into the mandatory Parameter `customData` = `de_reason_code::allowedValue`

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: Report template (currently unncessary to provide.)

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: An ISO/Alpha-2 country code to display any special mandatory parameters when ordering a Credit Report in that territory.

customData.description:
DE report retrieval reason code:
1 - Credit Decisioning
2 - Credit Assessment - Future business connection (with credit risk)
3 - Credit Assessment - Existing business connection (with credit risk)
4 - Realisation check receivables collection
5 - Purchase Contract - Intention of signature of purchase contract (with credit risk)
6 - Goods Credit Insurance (with credit risk)
7 - Contract - Intention of signature of leasing or rent contract (with credit risk)
8 - Insurance Contract - Intention of signature of a insurance contract (with credit risk)

get.description: Returns the available Images for a given Company connectId.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The company's connectId.

parameters.name: olderThan
parameters.description: Returns Images older than this date. Use with newerThan parameter.

parameters.name: newerThan
parameters.description: Returns Images newer than this date. Use with olderThan parameter.

get.description: Returns the type of Image that can be returned by for additional meta data.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Filter Images by country.

get.description: Endpoint to order an Image Document by Image ID.

parameters.name: imageId
parameters.description: Image ID retrieved from `images/companies`

200.description: Image object as a binary stream.

post.description: Places an order for a Fresh Investigation (Offline Report). Providing as much detail as   possible about the Company, our team will use official sources and registries to quickly answer questions about a companyâ€™s stability and financial health. Fresh Investigations take 5.5 days on average to complete.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Company connectId.

get.description: Returns a list of historic and ongoing Fresh Investigations.

example.message: Delete request has been made successfully on FreshInvestigation OrderId :{orderId}

get.description: Endpoint to return all user details relating to the Global Monitoring product.

200.description: An array object containing the user's details.

get.description: Endpoint to return a collection of `events` for the given company, optionally filtered on the supplied search criteria. Event information will only be returned if the company exists in at least one of your `portfolios`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The connectId of the company that you wish to retrieve events for.

get.description: Get all available notification event rules. Notification event rules allow you to control which events you wish to monitor for the `companies` contained within a given `portfolio`.

Get all available notification event rules for the given `countryCode`. Notification event rules allow you to control which events you wish to monitor for the `companies` contained within a given `portfolio`.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: ISO/Alpha 2 format country code for which notification event rules will be retured.

get.description: Get all notification events generated for companies monitored in your portfolios, based on the notification rules enabled. The notification events returned will be filtered based upon the supplied search criteria.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Return notificationEvents that match the given value

get.description: Endpoint to get all Portfolios based on the supplied Search Criteria.

parameters.name: searchQuery
parameters.description: Return portfolios that match the given value

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Starting page number (indexed from 0).

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of items to return per Page (max 1000).

post.description: Endpoint to create a new Portfolio based on the supplied criteria. A portfolio can contain any number of `companies` that you wish to monitor changes to.

get.description: Get the portfolio with portfolioId = portfolioId}
Get a list of distinct countries of companies monitored within a portfolio.

Get all notification `eventRules` for the given `portfolioId`. Notification event rules allow you to control which events you wish to monitor for the `companies` contained within the given `portfolio`.

parameters.name: portfolioId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the portfolio that you wish to retrieve notification event rules for, obtained from `/portfolios`.

200.description: An array of `eventRules` for the given `portfolioId`.

post.description: Copy companies from one portfolio to single (or) multiple portfolios.

parameters.name: copyAll
parameters.description: When CopyAll queryparameter is False, portfolios and companies list needs to be passed. When CopyAll queryparameter is True, only portfolios need to be passed and companies List must be empty. All companies are copied from current portfolio are considered here.

post.description: Move companies from one portfolio to single (or) multiple portfolios.
post.operationId: Moves (cuts) companies from one portfolio to another

parameters.name: removeAll
parameters.description: When RemoveAll queryparameter is False, portfolios and companies List needs to be passed. When RemoveAll queryparameter is True, only portfolios need to be passed and companies List must be empty. All companies are moved and deleted from current portfolio

parameters.name: clearAll
parameters.description: When ClearAll queryparameter is False,Companies List needs to be passed. When ClearAll queryparameter is True, Companies List must be empty. All companies will be deleted

post.description: Calls a Decision Tree with the provided parameters to return a Decision.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: the connectId of the company to be evaluated in the  deicison tree.

parameters.name: originationId
parameters.description: the origin id of the company we want a decision on. Only up to 100 characters are allowed, the rest will be truncated.

parameters.name: callRef
parameters.description: Call Reference

parameters.name: provenirId
parameters.description: Decision Tree GUID

authHeader.name: Authorization
authHeader.description: Bearer JWT (Authentication Token) generated from the /authenticate endpoint.

startDate.name: startDate
startDate.description: The start date on which results are filtered.

endDate.name: endDate
endDate.description: The end date on which results are filtered.

pageSize.name: pageSize
pageSize.description: Number of items to return per Page (max 1000)

sortBy.name: sortBy
sortBy.description: Sort results by this column. Null values of sort column are listed after non-nulls.

sortDir.name: sortDir
sortDir.description: The direction that you wish to sort results by.

PortfolioRequest.description: A JSON object containing portfolio information.

address.simpleValue: KIMBOLTON ROAD, BOLNHURST, BEDFORD, BEDFORDSHIRE, MK44 2ES
HESKETH HOUSE 43-45 PORTMAN SQUARE, 43-45 PORTMAN SQUARE, LONDON, Greater London, W1H 6HN

size.description: The maximum number of results returned per page.

prev.description: The page number of the previous page, null if there is no previous page available.

next.description: The page number of the next page, null if there is no next page available.

last.description: The page number of the last page.

countryCode.description: The ISO/Alpha 2 format country code for the user's country.

createdDate.description: The date that the Global Monitoring user account was created.

csCustomerId.description: The unique identifier for the user's customer account, used across the Creditsafe product suite.

csUserId.description: The unique identifier for the user's account, used across the Creditsafe product suite.

isAutoTracker.description: If auto-tracker is enabled, any companies that you pull a credit report for are automatically added to the portfolio that you have selected as default.

languageCode.description: The language code for the user's preferred language.

lastAccessDate.description: The date the the user last accessed the Global Monitoring product.

modifiedDate.description: The date that the user's details were last modified.

contractEndDate.description: The date that the user's contract is currently set to expire. From this date onward, the user will be unable to access to Global Monitoring product.

userId.description: The internal identifier used to reference the user's account through the Global Monitoring product.

id.description: The connectId of the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`. A connectId is the primary Company identifier that is used to uniquely identify all companies across Creditsafe's Universe and Partner Network.

safeNumber.description: The Safe Number (Creditsafe's identifier on all Companies owned in the Creditsafe Universe) of the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`.

name.description: The name of the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`.

countryCode.description: ISO/Alpha 2 format country code of the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`.

portfolioId.description: The portfolio Id of the portfolio that contains the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`.

portfolioName.description: The name of the portfolio that contains the company that triggered the `notificationEvent`.

eventId.description: The unique identifier for the event.

companyId.description: The Safe Number (Creditsafe's identifier on all Companies owned in the Creditsafe Universe) of the company that triggered the event.

portfolioId.description: The portfolio Id of the portfolio that contains the company that you requested event information for.

ruleName.description: A short description of the company event.

localEventCode.description: The local event code for the event.

globalEventCode.description: The global event code that has been mapped to the local event.

newValue.description: Some events contain an `oldValue` and `newValue` (e.g. a change in Credit Limit).

oldValue.description: Some events contain an `oldValue` and `newValue` (e.g. a change in Credit Limit).

eventDate.description: The date that the event occured.

createdDate.description: The date that the event was created in the Creditsafe database.

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event that triggered the generation of the `notificationEvent`. This identifier is consistent across all portfolios in the Global Monitoring product.

eventDate.description: The date that the event occured.

newValue.description: Some events contain an `oldValue` and `newValue` (e.g. a change in Credit Limit).

oldValue.description: Some events contain an `oldValue` and `newValue` (e.g. a change in Credit Limit).

notificationEventId.description: The unique identifier for the `notificationEvent`. This identifier is tied to a specific `eventId` and `portfolioId`.

ruleCode.description: The unique identifier for the `ruleCode` that triggered the generation of the `notificationEvent`.

ruleName.description: The name of the notification event rule that triggered the generation of the `notificationEvent`.

totalCount.description: The total number of events returned for the given company.
The total number of events returned for the given company.

isActive.description: Shows whether the notification event rule has been enabled for the given portfolio.

ruleCode.description: The unique identifier for the notification event rule.

ruleCountryCode.description: The ISO/Alpha 2 format country code for the notification event rule. "XX" is used for global rules that apply to companies from all countries.

ruleType.description: The unique identifier of the `ruleType` for the notification event rule.

ruleTypeName.description: A short description of the `ruleType` for the notification event rule.

name.description: The name for the notification event rule.
name.example: International Rating | Reduce by {0} Band(s) OR Less than Band {1}

param0.description: Some notification event rules may include input parameters used to tailor the notifications generated to your preference.

param1.description: Some notification event rules may include input parameters used to tailor the notifications generated to your preference.
